page.title: 12RADIO LANCASHIRE
page.content: It opened in January 1971 as B.B.C. {Radio Blackburn}in a converted motor- bike showroom.There were three stations going to open originally but Blackburn was the only one to go on air.It became{Radio Lancashire in 1981 to cover the whole county.The record library has 12,500 singles and 40,000 albums.The furthest broadcast has been heard in central Europe.The{audience is{100 to 150,000 people.}Hours of broadcasting are 6.30am till 7.00pm on weekdays and for 10 to 12 hours at weekends.There is a{staff of 39.}The news collection is from people who contact the station or is based on public press releases.{Future plans include the opening of a large studio, broadcasting in sterio, recording digitally & using compact discs played by laser.Out of{36 houses}in a{class {survey, 6}tuned into{Radio Lancashire.
